claim.body:
uplink transmit power control, comprising:
receiving an over-the-air broadcast of an overload indication from a neighboring node;
detecting the overload indication received on a physical broadcast channel (PBCH) from the neighboring node, wherein the receiving comprises receiving two resource blocks within a center of six resource blocks in a midamble of a shortened PBCH; and
performing transmit power control based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.

claim-text.content: 1. A method of performing uplink transmit power control, comprising:
receiving an over-the-air broadcast of an overload indication from a neighboring node;

detecting the overload indication received on a physical broadcast channel (PBCH) from the neighboring node, wherein the receiving comprises receiving two resource blocks within a center of six resource blocks in a midamble of a shortened PBCH; and
performing transmit power control based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.

claim.body: the transmit power control comprises adjusting transmit power spectral density.

content: , wherein performing the transmit power control comprises adjusting transmit power spectral density.

claim.body: the interference level comprises Interference over Thermal (IoT) noise.

content: , wherein the interference level comprises Interference over Thermal (IoT) noise.

claim.body: the overload indication as a bit carried by the PBCH.

content: , further comprising detecting the overload indication as a bit carried by the PBCH.

claim.body: the overload indication at an access terminal.

content: , wherein receiving comprises receiving the overload indication at an access terminal.

claim.body: the overload indication at a small base node comprising a selected one of a femto access point, a home base node, and a closed subscription cell.

content: , wherein receiving comprises receiving the overload indication at a small base node comprising a selected one of a femto access point, a home base node, and a closed subscription cell.

claim.body: an access terminal in a coverage area of the small base node to adjust transmit power spectral density based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.

content: , wherein performing comprises instructing an access terminal in a coverage area of the small base node to adjust transmit power spectral density based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.

claim.body:
uplink transmit power control, comprising:
receiving an over-the-air broadcast of an overload indication from a neighboring node,
detecting the overload indication received on a physical broadcast channel (PBCH) from the neighboring node;
masking a PBCH Cyclic Redundancy Check (CRC) based on the overload indication; and
performing transmit power control based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.

claim-text.content: 8. A method of performing uplink transmit power control, comprising:
receiving an over-the-air broadcast of an overload indication from a neighboring node,
detecting the overload indication received on a physical broadcast channel (PBCH) from the neighboring node;
masking a PBCH Cyclic Redundancy Check (CRC) based on the overload indication; and
performing transmit power control based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.
9. A method of performing uplink transmit power control, comprising:
receiving an over-the-air broadcast of an overload indication from a neighboring node;
detecting the overload indication received on a physical broadcast channel (PBCH) from the neighboring node;
scrambling the PBCH based on the overload indication; and
performing transmit power control based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.

claim.body:
uplink transmit power control, comprising:
receiving an over-the-air broadcast of an overload indication from a neighboring node;
detecting the overload indication received on a physical broadcast channel (PBCH) from the neighboring node as a bit per subband carried by the PBCH; and
performing transmit power control based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.

claim-text.content: 10. A method of performing uplink transmit power control, comprising:
receiving an over-the-air broadcast of an overload indication from a neighboring node;
detecting the overload indication received on a physical broadcast channel (PBCH) from the neighboring node as a bit per subband carried by the PBCH; and
performing transmit power control based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.
11. A method of performing uplink transmit power control, comprising:
receiving an over-the-air broadcast of an overload indication from a neighboring node;
detecting the overload indication received on a physical hybrid automatic repeat request indicator channel (PHICH);
reserving PHICH resources per cell to convey the overload indication; and
performing transmit power control based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.

claim.body: the PHICH resources on the PHICH that are orthogonal across a plurality of neighboring nodes for achieving a defined signal-to-noise ratio penetration.

content: , further comprising receiving the PHICH resources on the PHICH that are orthogonal across a plurality of neighboring nodes for achieving a defined signal-to-noise ratio penetration.

claim.body: a plurality of the PHICH resources to detect the overload indication.

content: , further comprising combining a plurality of the PHICH resources to detect the overload indication.

claim.body: a center portion of bandwidth used by the neighboring node.

content: , further comprising receiving a center portion of bandwidth used by the neighboring node.

claim.body: the overload indication as a Walsh code that is a function of a cell identifier for the neighboring node.

content: , further comprising detecting the overload indication as a Walsh code that is a function of a cell identifier for the neighboring node.

claim.body: the PHICH is time division multiplexed (TDM) modulated in a different time slot from a plurality of neighboring nodes.

content: , wherein the PHICH is time division multiplexed (TDM) modulated in a different time slot from a plurality of neighboring nodes.

claim.body: the PHICH is frequency division multiplexed (FDM) modulated in a different frequency resource from a plurality of neighboring nodes.

content: , wherein the PHICH is frequency division multiplexed (FDM) modulated in a different frequency resource from a plurality of neighboring nodes.

claim.body: the PHICH is code division multiplexed (CDM) modulated in a different Walsh code from a plurality of neighboring nodes.

content: , wherein the PHICH is code division multiplexed (CDM) modulated in a different Walsh code from a plurality of neighboring nodes.

claim.body:
the PHICH by receiving a plurality of PHICH resources assigned to the overload indication; and
combining log likelihood ratios for the plurality of PHICH resources prior to detecting the overload indication.

claim-text.content: receiving the PHICH by receiving a plurality of PHICH resources assigned to the overload indication; and
combining log likelihood ratios for the plurality of PHICH resources prior to detecting the overload indication.

claim.body: the PHICH by decoding with interference cancellation.

content: , further comprising receiving the PHICH by decoding with interference cancellation.
